definition[0]: a piece of writing, music etc or an action that copies someone or something in an amusing way
example[0]: Her performance contains a strong element of self-parody  (=when someone makes fun of their own style).
example[1]: a brilliant parody of classical dance
example[2]: He swung the door wide open in a parody of welcome.
definition[1]: something that is not a correct or acceptable example of something
example[3]: The trial was a parody of justice  (=very unfair).
example[4]: Although his comment was a parody of the truth, Diana was upset by it.
definition[2]: to copy someone or something in a way that makes people laugh
example[5]: His style has often been parodied.
